body: @isdom this is because of the caches... when you deallocate the buffers they will first end up in ThreadLocal caches. Only after these removed from the caches they are really deallocated. You can disable the caches to see it.
@isdom doh! You are right. Want to do a PR or should I take care ?
@isdom ok cool... Would be nice if just would calculate if its tiny/small/normal allocation one time though and not need to do multiple times üëç

issue.title: fix #6282: calculate correct count for PoolArena's tiny/small/normal allocation

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Disable ThreadLocal Cache, then allocate Pooled ByteBuf and release all these buffers, PoolArena's  tiny/small/normal allocation count incorrect.

Modifications:

- Calculate PoolArena's tiny/small/normal allocation one time 
- Add testAllocationCounter TestCase

Result:

Fixes #6282 .
